intro: Acranthera strigosa, commonly known as the hairy acranthera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, narrow leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowering period occurs during the warmer months, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Acranthera strigosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display.
